tion, stated:
"One of the basic problems in providing educational facilities
is that of land space as well as classroom buildings. Adequate
availability of television channels, both high-power, which
would facilitate multiple channel use could reduce the exist¬
ing need for educational opportunities for students. This con¬
cept would involve at least one high-power station in each metro¬
politan area, plus four or five low»pover multiple channels.

television channels for instruction in the future; they must
be reserved now.”
